Class RectangleRDD

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.datasyslab.geospark.spatialRDD.RectangleRDD
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RectangleRDD
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Class RectangleRDD. It accommodates Rectangle object.
    Author:
    Arizona State University DataSystems Lab

        The SpatialRDD partitioned by spatial grids. Each integer is a spatial partition id

        public java.util.HashSet<EnvelopeWithGrid> grids

        The partitoned SpatialRDD with built spatial indexes. Each integer is a spatial partition id

        public org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<com.vividsolutions.jts.index.strtree.STRtree> indexedRDDNoId
        The partitoned SpatialRDD with built spatial indexes. Indexes are built on JavaRDD without spatial partitioning.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RectangleRDD

        public RectangleRDD(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Envelope> rawRectangleRDD)
        Initialize one SpatialRDD with one existing SpatialRDD
        Parameters:
        rawRectangleRDD - One existing raw RectangleRDD

      • RectangleRDD

        public RectangleRDD(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext spark,
                    java.lang.String InputLocation,
                    java.lang.Integer Offset,
                    java.lang.String Splitter,
                    java.lang.Integer partitions)
        Initialize one raw SpatialRDD with a raw input file
        Parameters:
        spark - SparkContext which defines some Spark configurations
        InputLocation - specify the input path which can be a HDFS path
        Offset - specify the starting column of valid spatial attributes in CSV and TSV. e.g. XXXX,XXXX,x,y,XXXX,XXXX
        Splitter - specify the input file format: csv, tsv, geojson, wkt
        partitions - specify the partition number of the SpatialRDD

      • RectangleRDD

        public RectangleRDD(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext spark,
                    java.lang.String InputLocation,
                    java.lang.Integer Offset,
                    java.lang.String Splitter)
        Initialize one raw SpatialRDD with a raw input file
        Parameters:
        spark - SparkContext which defines some Spark configurations
        InputLocation - specify the input path which can be a HDFS path
        Offset - specify the starting column of valid spatial attributes in CSV and TSV. e.g. XXXX,XXXX,x,y,XXXX,XXXX
        Splitter - specify the input file format: csv, tsv, geojson, wkt

      • RectangleRDD

        public RectangleRDD(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                    java.lang.String inputLocation,
                    java.lang.Integer offSet,
                    java.lang.String splitter,
                    java.lang.String gridType,
                    java.lang.Integer numPartitions)
        Initialize one raw SpatialRDD with a raw input file and do spatial partitioning on it
        Parameters:
        sc - spark SparkContext which defines some Spark configurations
        inputLocation - specify the input path which can be a HDFS path
        offSet - specify the starting column of valid spatial attributes in CSV and TSV. e.g. XXXX,XXXX,x,y,XXXX,XXXX
        splitter - specify the input file format: csv, tsv, geojson, wkt
        gridType - specify the spatial partitioning method: equalgrid, rtree, voronoi
        numPartitions - specify the partition number of the SpatialRDD

      • RectangleRDD

        public RectangleRDD(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext sc,
                    java.lang.String inputLocation,
                    java.lang.Integer offSet,
                    java.lang.String splitter,
                    java.lang.String gridType)
        Initialize one raw SpatialRDD with a raw input file and do spatial partitioning on it without specifying the number of partitions.
        Parameters:
        sc - spark SparkContext which defines some Spark configurations
        inputLocation - specify the input path which can be a HDFS path
        offSet - specify the starting column of valid spatial attributes in CSV and TSV. e.g. XXXX,XXXX,x,y,XXXX,XXXX
        splitter - specify the input file format: csv, tsv, geojson, wkt
        gridType - specify the spatial partitioning method: equalgrid, rtree, voronoi

    • Method Detail

      • buildIndex

        public void buildIndex(java.lang.String indexType)
        Create an IndexedRDD and cache it in memory. Need to have a grided RDD first. The index is build on each partition.
        Parameters:
        indexType - Specify the index type: rtree, quadtree
